New Roster (Age of Sigmar) [730pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 2,000 (Chaos - Beasts of Chaos) [730pts]

    Rules: At the Double, Forward to Victory, Inspiring Presence

    • Uncategorised

      • Herdstone

        Categories: SCENERY

        Unit Abilities: Entropic Lodestone, Locus of Savagery


        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Entropic Lodestone Subtract 1 from save rolls for attacks that target units within 6" of this terrain feature. At the start of each battle round after the first, add 6" to the range of this ability. BEASTS OF CHAOS units are not affected by this ability.
        Locus of Savagery BEASTS OF CHAOS units wholly within 6" of this terrain feature do not take battleshock tests. At the start of each battle round after the first, add 6" to the range of this ability

    • Leader [190pts]

      • Beastlord [90pts]

        Selections: Blade of the Desecrator, Dominator, General, Paired Man-ripper Axes

        Categories: HERO, BEASTLORD, GOR, CHAOS, BEASTS OF CHAOS, BRAYHERD, Leader, General

        Artefact: Blade of the Desecrator, Command Abilities: Grisly Trophy, Command Trait: Dominator, Unit: Beastlord, Unit Abilities: Dual Axes, Hatred of Heroes, Weapon: Paired Man-ripper Axes


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Blade of the Desecrator Pick one of the bearer’s melee weapons. Improve the Rend characteristic of that weapon by 1 for attacks that target a unit of 10 or more models. Improve the Rend characteristic of that weapon by 2 instead for attacks that target a unit of 20 or more models. Attacks made by this weapon cannot have a Rend characteristic greater than -3.
        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Grisly Trophy You can use this command ability in the combat phase if any attacks made by a friendly BEASTLORD with this command ability resulted in an enemy model being slain in that phase. If you do so, until the end of that phase, you can re-roll wound rolls for attacks made by friendly BRAYHERD units wholly within 18" of that BEASTLORD. If any attacks made by that BEASTLORD resulted in an enemy HERO or MONSTER being slain that phase, you can re-roll both hit rolls and wound rolls for attacks made by friendly BRAYHERD units wholly within 18" of that BEASTLORD instead.
        Command Trait Command Trait Details Ref
        Dominator You can re-roll charge rolls made for friendly ALLHERD units wholly within 18" of this general if this general is within 3" of any enemy units.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Beastlord 6"574+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Dual Axes You can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks made with Paired Man-ripper Axes.
        Hatred of Heroes You can re-roll failed wound rolls for attacks made by this model that target a HERO.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Paired Man-ripper Axes Melee1"63+3+-11

      • Great Bray-shaman [100pts]

        Selections: Arcane Bolt, Devolve, Fetish Staff, Mystic Shield

        Categories: HERO, WIZARD, GOR, BEASTS OF CHAOS, BRAYHERD, GREAT BRAY-SHAMAN, CHAOS, Leader

        Magic: Great Bray-shaman, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Devolve, Mystic Shield, Unit: Great Bray-shaman, Unit Abilities: Infuse with Bestial Vigour, Weapon: Fetish Staff


        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Great Bray-shaman 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Devolve
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Devolve 7If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them and not within 3" of any friendly units. Your opponent must move that unit up to 2D6" so that each model in the unit ends its move as close as possible to a model from the friendly unit that was closest to it at the start of the move.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Great Bray-shaman 6"566+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Infuse with Bestial Vigour At the start of your movement phase, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in friendly BRAYHERD units wholly within 12" of any friendly GREAT BRAY-SHAMANS until the end of that phase.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Fetish Staff Melee2"14+3+-1D3

    • Battleline [490pts]

      • Bestigors [120pts]

        Selections: 10 Bestigors [120pts], Banner bearers, Brayhorns, Despoiler Axe

        Categories: BEASTS OF CHAOS, BRAYHERD, CHAOS, BESTIGORS, GOR, Other, Battleline

        Unit: Bestigors, Unit Abilities: Banner Bearers, Bestial Charge, Brayhorns, Despoilers, Gouge-horn, Weapon: Despoiler Axe


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Bestigors 6"164+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Banner Bearers 1 in every 10 models in this unit can be a Banner Bearer. A unit that includes any Banner Bearers can move an extra 1" when it runs or piles in.
        Bestial Charge Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit's melee weapons in a turn in which it made a charge move.
        Brayhorns 1 in every 10 models in this unit can have a Brayhorn. A unit that includes any Brayhorns can run and still charge later in the same turn.
        Despoilers Add 1 to hit rolls for attacks made by this unit that target enemy units with 10 or more models. In addition, you can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks by this unit that target ORDER units.
        Gouge-horn The leader of this unit is a Gouge-horn. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Gouge-horn's Despoiler Axe.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Despoiler Axe Melee1"24+3+-11

      • Gors [70pts]

        Selections: 10 Gors [70pts], Banner bearers, Brayhorns, Gor Blade and Beastshield

        Categories: GOR, BRAYHERD, BEASTS OF CHAOS, CHAOS, Battleline

        Unit: Gor, Unit Abilities: Anarchy and Mayhem, Banner Bearers, Beastshields, Brayhorns, Foe-render, Weapon: Gor Blade


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Gor 6"155+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Anarchy and Mayhem Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit's melee weapons while it has 20 or more models.
        Banner Bearers 1 in every 10 models in this unit can be a Banner Bearer. A unit that includes any Banner Bearers can move an extra 1" when it runs or piles in.
        Beastshields Add 1 to save rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target a unit with Beastshields.
        Brayhorns 1 in every 10 models in this unit can have a Brayhorn. A unit that includes any Brayhorns can run and still charge later in the same turn.
        Foe-render The leader of this unit is a Foe-render. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Foe-render's Gor Blade(s).

      • Ungors [60pts]

        Selections: 10 Ungors [60pts], Banner bearers, Brayhorns, Ungor Blade

        Categories: BRAYHERD, BEASTS OF CHAOS, CHAOS, UNGOR, Battleline

        Unit: Ungors, Unit Abilities: Banner Bearers, Baying Hatred, Brayhorns, Half-shields, Halfhorn, Weapon: Ungor Blade


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Ungors 6"146+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Banner Bearers 1 in every 10 models in this unit can be a Banner Bearer. A unit that includes any Banner Bearers can move an extra 1" when it runs or piles in.
        Baying Hatred You can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for attacks made by this unit while it has 20 or more models, or re-roll hit rolls of 1 and 2 for attacks made by this unit while it has 30 or more models.
        Brayhorns 1 in every 10 models in this unit can have a Brayhorn. A unit that includes any Brayhorns can run and still charge later in the same turn.
        Half-shields Add 1 to save rolls for attacks made with melee weapons that target this unit.
        Halfhorn The leader of this unit is a Halfhorn. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Halfhorn's Ungor Blade or Gnarled Shortspear.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Ungor Blade Melee1"14+4+-1

    • Allegiance

      • Allegiance

        Categories: Allegiance

        • Beasts of Chaos

          Selections: Allherd

          Categories: Allegiance: Khorne

          Battle Trait: Bestial Might, Bloodgorge, Brayherd Ambush, Creatures of the Storm, Primordial Call, The Herdstone, Command Abilities: Booming Roar, Primordial Call Table: (01) 1 Chimera, (02) 1 Ghorgon, (03) 3 Tzaangor Skyfires, (04) Chaos Gargant, (05) 1 Cygor, (06) 10 Tzaangors, (07) 3 Bulgors, (08) 1 Jabberslythe, (09) 3 Dragon Ogors, (10) 3 Tzaangor Enilightened on Discs of Tzeentch, (11) 10 Bestigors, (12) 1 Cockatrice, (13) 3 Tzaangor Enlightened, (14) 5 Centigors, (15) 10 Chaos Warhounds, (16) 10 Gors, (17) 10 Ungor Raiders, (18) 1 Chaos Spawn, (19) 1 Tuskgor Chariot, (20) 1 Razorgor, (21) 10 Ungors


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Bestial Might Subtract 1 from battleshock rolls made for ALLHERD units in the battleshock phase if they were picked to fight in the combat phase of the same turn.
        Bloodgorge At the end of the combat phase, if any attacks made by a WARHERD unit in that combat phase destroyed any enemy units, heal D3 wounds allocated to that WARHERD unit.
        Brayherd Ambush Instead of setting up a BRAYHERD unit on the battlefield, you can place it to one side and say that it is set up in ambush as a reserve unit. You can set up one reserve unit in ambush for each BEASTS OF CHAOS unit you have set up on the battlefield. At the end of your first movement phase, you must set up all friendly reserve units that are in ambush on the battlefield, wholly within 6" of the edge of the battlefield and more than 9" from any enemy units. Any reserve units that cannot be set up are slain
        Creatures of the Storm At the start of your hero phase, roll a dice. Each friendly THUNDERSCORN unit more than 3" from any enemy units can move a distance in inches equal to the roll, but cannot move within 3" of any enemy units.
        Primordial Call You can summon units of BEASTS OF CHAOS to the battlefield if you collect enough Primordial Call points. At the start of your hero phase, you receive 1 Primordial Call point. In addition, in your hero phase you can choose one friendly BEASTS OF CHAOS HERO within 3" of the HERDSTONE you set up at the start of the battle and say that they will enact a savage blood ritual. If you do so, pick a friendly BEASTS OF CHAOS unit within 3" of the HERDSTONE. That unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. For each mortal wound inflicted on that unit, you receive 1 Primordial Call point. If you have 3 or more Primordial Call points at the end of your movement phase, you can summon one or more units from the following list onto the battlefield, and add them to your army. Each unit you summon costs a number of Primordial Call points, as shown on the list, and you can only summon a unit if you have enough Primordial Call points remaining to pay its cost. Summoned units must be set up wholly within 6" of the edge of the battlefield and more than 9" from any enemy units. Subtract the cost of the summoned unit from the number of Primordial Call points you have available immediately after it has been set up.
        The Herdstone After territories have been chosen but before players begin to set up their armies, you can set up one HERDSTONE wholly within your territory, more than 12" from enemy territory and more than 1" from any other terrain features. If both players can set up a terrain feature in this manner, each player rolls a dice, rolling again in the case of a tie, and whoever rolls higher can choose the order in which the terrain features are set up.
        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Booming Roar You can use this command ability at the start of your hero phase if your general is on the battlefield. If you do so, you receive 1 Primordial Call point.
        Primordial Call Table Cost Ref
        (01) 1 Chimera 10
        (02) 1 Ghorgon 10
        (03) 3 Tzaangor Skyfires 10
        (04) Chaos Gargant 9
        (05) 1 Cygor 9
        (06) 10 Tzaangors 9
        (07) 3 Bulgors 8
        (08) 1 Jabberslythe 8

        (19) 1 Tuskgor Chariot 3

    • Realm of Battle

      • Realm of Battle

        Selections: Battle: Ulgu

        Categories: Realm of Battle

        Spell: Aetheric Tendrils, Bridge of Shadows, Crown of Asphyxiation, Labyrinth of Sorrows, Phantasmal Guardian, The Enfeebling


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Aetheric Tendrils 6If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 12" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. If that unit is a HERO or MONSTER, you can make a normal move with that unit as if it had a Move characteristic of 4". Malign Sorcery p77
        Bridge of Shadows 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit wholly within 12" of the caster and remove it from the battlefield. Set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is wholly within 24" of the caster and more than 9" from any enemy models. It may not move in the subsequent movement phase. Malign Sorcery p77
        Crown of Asphyxiation 6If successfully cast, roll a dice for each enemy unit within 3" of the caster. On a 4+ that unit suffers 1 mortal wound. Malign Sorcery p77
        Labyrinth of Sorrows 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 12" of the caster that is visible to them. Halve the Move characteristic of that unit until your next hero phase. Malign Sorcery p77
        Phantasmal Guardian 6If successfully cast, roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to the caster until your next hero phase. On a 5+ the wound is negated. Malign Sorcery p77
        The Enfeebling 6If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 12" of the caster. Re-roll failed wound rolls for attacks that target this unit until your next hero phase. Malign Sorcery p77

Force Rules

At the Double: You can use this command ability after you make a run roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, the run roll is treated as being a 6. (Core Rules p3)

Forward to Victory: You can use this command ability after you make a charge roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, re-roll the charge roll. (Core Rules p3)

Inspiring Presence: You can use this command ability at the start of the battleshock phase. If you do so, pick a friendly unit that is within 6" of friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. That unit does not have to take battleshock tests in that phase. (Core Rules p3)
